publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-05 20:56:43 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series: Administrative and legal files; Correspondence; Meeting files; and Project files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection include meeting minutes, correspondence, planning materials, and subject files related to the Corporation and its plans to construct a multi-purpose medical building on top of South Station in Boston. The bulk of the materials date from the late 1980s and early 1990s. Many subject files specifically address issues related to securing the air rights for the building.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Tufts Development Corporation is a privately held corporation established to manage Tufts' investments. Established in 1989, the Corporation's main focus has been the construction of a skyscraper on top of South Station in Boston, near the Tufts Boston Campus.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records containing information related to student education, staff and faculty employment, and Board of Trustees records are closed for 75 years from the date of creation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of files which document the incorporation of the Tufts Development Corporation and its legal status. Many files also reference the main project in the Project files: the construction of a building on South Station, Boston.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
